result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew S. Carlson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Retain Possession (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. 
Cases 22CM305, 22CM180, 22CM20, 22CM19, 21CM1019, 21CM1008, 21CM994 dismissed and read in.

miscConds.notes: Complete AODA and follow through with recommendations.

Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Participate on Eau Claire County Comprehensive Community Services (CCS) Program through EC DHS. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Provide a DNA sample. 
If defendant would like to apologize to the victims, defendant is to provide the apology letters to the probation agent who will provide them to the victim/witness office within the DA's office.

No contact with: Kwik Trip, Vine Street Laundry, London Road Laundromat, Lismore Hotel, any Walgreens, any Festival Foods, any Family Dollar, UWEC Campus, 507 Dodge St., Spin City Laundry, Haymarket Landing Apartment building, or any bar liquor store or tavern. No contact with: A.J., M.M., G.P., A.W. or any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting.

defendant.name: Carlson, Matthew S.

records.addlTxt:
Restitution Ordered in the amount of $13.96
Plus 10% Restitution Surcharge
Plea questionnaire/waiver of rights with attached elements

2:45 PM cases 21CM571, 21CM616, 21CM758, 21CM984, 21CM994, 21CM1003, 21CM1004, 21CM1008, 21CM1019, 22CM19, 22CM20,22CM21, 22CM180, 22CM301, 22CM303, 22CM305 called. Prosecuting attorney Peter J. Rindal in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Matthew S. Carlson in court, in custody.  Attorney James H Krave in court for Matthew S. Carlson. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. The State recites the joint recommendation. Court questions the State as to the agreement. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
As to Count 1 in 21CM571 as charged: Defendant pleads Guilty. 
As to Count 2 in 21CM571 as charged: Defendant pleads Guilty. 
As to Count 1 in 21CM616 as charged: Defendant pleads Guilty. 
As to Count 8 in 21CM758 as charged: Defendant pleads Guilty. 
As to Count 1 in 21CM984 as charged: Defendant pleads Guilty. 
As to Count 1 in 21CM1003 as charged: Defendant pleads Guilty. 
As to Count 2 in 21CM1004 as charged: Defendant pleads Guilty. 
As to Count 1 in 21CM21 as charged: Defendant pleads Guilty. 
As to Count 1 in 22CM301 as charged: Defendant pleads Guilty. 
As to Count 2 in 22CM303 as charged: Defendant pleads Guilty. 

Court accepts all of the defendant's pleas and finds the defendant Guilty. 

On each count: Court Imposes but Stays 9 months in Jail on each count to run concurrent to one another. 
Defendant is placed on Probation for 2 years with conditions: 
Complete AODA and follow through with recommendations. 
Maintain absolute sobriety. Participate on Eau Claire County Comprehensive Community Services (CCS) Program through EC DHS. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
No contact with: Kwik Trip, Vine Street Laundry, London Road Laundromat, Lismore Hotel, any Walgreens, any Festival Foods, any Family Dollar, UWEC Campus, 507 Dodge St., Spin City Laundry, Haymarket Landing Apartment building, or any bar liquor store or tavern. 
No contact with:  A.J., M.M., G.P., A.W. or any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting. 
Pay costs including applicable surcharges (one bench warrant fee in 21CM571), and restitution in 22CM21 totaling $13.96 and the 10% surcharge. Restitution in other files is to remain open for 60 days 
If defendant would like to apologize to the victims, defendant is to provide the apology letters to the probation agent who will provide them to the victim/witness office within the DA's office. 

As to 22FO211: Defendant pleads Guilty. 
As to 22FO280: Defendant pleads Guilty. 
Court accepts pleas, finds the defendant and orders as to 22FO211: fine and costs totaling $200.50 and as to 22FO280: fine and costs totaling $295.00. 
Anything else is dismissed and read in. 
If revoked from probation defendant has 3 days credit in 21CM571, 78 days credit in 22CM301, 78 days credit in 22CM303 and 1 day credit in all other files.
Status conference on July 25, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Cases called at 2:00 PM: 21CM571, 21CM616, 21CM758, 21CM984, 21CM994, 21CM1003, 21CM1004, 21CM1008, 21CM1019, 22CM19, 22CM20, 22CM21, 22CM180, 22CM301, 22CM303, 22CM305.
Defendant Matthew S. Carlson appeared by video, in custody from the St. Croix County Jail.  Attorney James H Krave not in court.  Attorney Matthew Kirkpatrick appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Warrants quashed. 22CM301, 22CM303, 22CM305: State requests $2,000 Cash Band. Court so orders.
Branch 1 to schedule further proceedings with Attorney Krave.

11:32 AM  Cases called: 21CM571, 21CM616, 21CM758, 21CM984, 21CM994, 21CM1003, 21CM1004, 21CM1008, 21CM1019, 22CM19, 22CM20, 22CM21, 22CM180, 22CM301, 22CM303 & 22CM305. Defendant Matthew S. Carlson not in court.  Attorney James H Krave in court for Matthew S. Carlson.  Attorney Peter J. Rindal in court for State of Wisconsin. 

State requests a warrant and a cash bond due to the number of cases and history of non appearances. 

Court orders warrant in all cases. Defendant must appear in front of Br. 1 in person to quash the warrants.
Status conference on April 14, 2022 at 11:30 am.

9:32 AM Cases called: 21CM571, 21CM616, 21CM758, 21CM984, 21CM994, 21CM1003, 21CM1004, 21CM1008, 21CM1019, 22CM19, 22CM20, 22CM21 and 22CM180. Defendant Matthew S. Carlson appeared in court, Attorney James H Krave appeared by video for Matthew S. Carlson. Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
22CM180: Waives reading of the complaint. Bond is set. 
Due to the number of open cases - all cases are referred to Br. 1 for scheduling.
